definition: to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: They scrambled over the broken walls and, within a very short time, captured the city.
sentences.chinese: 他们攀过破碎的城墙，用很短的时间就夺取了城市。

sentences.english: This feign, the Eastern Zhou Dynasty is planted afresh certainly paddy, when reaping, you capture again they.
sentences.chinese: 这佯，东周一定重新种稻，收割时您再夺取它们。

sentences.english: She wrested the will from her brother's hands.
sentences.chinese: 她从弟弟手中夺取玩具。

sentences.english: It looked like another victory for technology in the hands of the good guys.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来像是正义之师在科技界夺取的又一场胜利。

sentences.english: “They should never have tried to take the port, ” Abrahim said.
sentences.chinese: “他们再也不敢试图夺取港口了，”亚伯拉罕说。

sentences.english: Gone are the days of Mao when peasant uprisings could collectively capture the nation.
sentences.chinese: 在农民起义共同夺取国家政权之后，毛时代就在消亡。

sentences.english: Our party seized power after a long-term revolutionary struggle.
sentences.chinese: 我们党是经过长期革命斗争夺取政权的。

sentences.english: The prime minister YuWenHuaJi in order to take the throne with collude with the turks.
sentences.chinese: 丞相宇文化及为了夺取皇位同突厥暗中勾结。

sentences.english: All the soldiers were ordered to go in and seize the city.
sentences.chinese: 全体士兵接到命令发动进攻，夺取该城。

sentences.english: “The sultan came to power by force of arms, carried out against his father with British help, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 卡布斯用武力夺取政权，得到了英国人的帮助。

sentences.english: Bound for the prize of (all too precious) you.
sentences.chinese: 扬帆直驶去夺取太宝贵的你。

sentences.english: Coup plotters tried to seize power in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 政变密谋者试图夺取莫斯科的政权。

sentences.english: Still,maybe we'd say,yeah,the people have been taken over.
sentences.chinese: 也许我们会说，这些人的肉体被夺取了。

sentences.english: Capturing the enemy-held towns is the pivot of our plans.
sentences.chinese: 夺取敌人控制的城镇，是我们计画的轴心。

sentences.english: And Gerro insists the super-stylish Reds wil NEVER have a better chance to finish champions.
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德说现在是红军夺取冠军的最好时机。

sentences.english: And a man was killed since ancient times in the reign of battlefield, seize power.
sentences.chinese: 而男人自古就是杀死战场，腥风血雨中夺取权势。

definition: to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to dip a finger (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action/abbr. for 染指於鼎|染指于鼎
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
